text: <!here|@here> jumpin back in on some stuff - has anyone heard from Robert (ZGF) RE floor plans?  I kow some of the team went over there to talk Winter Lights.  not sure if he brought it up.
i havent heard back, i expect it would come through <@U02F8LF2X>?
thanks <@U0K8ZSHN0> i have a note out to robert

an update and a questions:

update: Marce is doing a building tour with some interested parties on Friday at 1pm.  May ask some of y’all to join based on casting/calendars.  
question: <@U0K8ZSHN0> and <@U02F8LF2X> do we hve any sense of minimum electrical capacity for the building?  Beam is getting some convos going with PGE to get the building ready and any info we have around baselines would help.
good question, doubt we have a quantified number at the moment
yeah i suspected as much but do we know about standards?  anything like ‘no less than___'
it’s dependent on equipment
let me get together with josh and discuss to see if we can come up with a ballpark
yeah, lotsa moving pieces right now - i dont expect we’ll know exact needs but a benchmark would help
added up the big machines in the "Equipment" tab and got 196amps at 480v
these are most of the big power draw machines
so if I had to guess something like 400amp? 500amp?
3 phase 480v
how many people (and their computers) do we plan to have?
also that cnc press brake looks cool
<@U0K8ZSHN0> at any given point 40+ ppl on computz
basically zero
its another 30ish amps for people and their laptops/monitors/cell phones charging
30amps at 120v?
the mbp chargers pull 0.5A
so that's 7 amps at 480v
basically zero
i didnt realize it came into the building at 480v
or rather, the 400-500amp config was based on the 480
<— not an electrician, just an electrical engineer :slightly_smiling_face:
it's dependent on the amount of power you need but if you need a lot of power you bring it in at 480v
I want 1000V:zap:
MORE POWER
Max power.
